message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.EC 

This paper discusses the redesign of Bitcoin's fee market mechanism, which involves analyzing the incentives and revenue extraction of different auction mechanisms. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it deals with the security of the Bitcoin system. It also involves game theory (cs.GT) as the authors analyze the strategic behavior of users in the fee market. Additionally, the paper involves distributed computing (cs.DC) as it discusses the block propagation and other security concerns related to block size. The analysis and simulations conducted in the paper also involve data structures (cs.DS) and economics and computation (cs.EC).
